articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Industrial Establishments
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Industrial Establishments 
Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to three factories in North Phyongan Province alive with a new year drive to bring about a boost in production.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Amnokgang Gauge and Instrument General Factory.
					
					 After being briefed on the factory before a huge map showing its panoramic view, Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, went round several places including processing shop and materials shop to learn in detail about its technical equipment and production. 
					
					 Watching CNC-based equipment standing in rows in every work site and products being churned out in an endless stream, he was greatly satisfied to learn that the workers of the factory are mass-producing varieties of quality gauges and instruments needed by different fields of the national economy. 
					
					 He said that the officials, workers and technicians of the factory waged a dynamic mass technical innovation movement true to the WPK's idea of attaching importance to science and technology, thus updating the factory as required by the IT age.
					
					 He went round various products displayed at the exhibition hall of August 3 consumer goods. He was very pleased that the factory is producing lots of quality consumer goods for improving people's standard of living by making an effective use of by-products.
					
					 He then looked round cultural and welfare establishments including the hall of culture, the canteen and the bathhouse built by the factory in a peculiar manner to learn about its workers' cultural life and supply service. 
					
					 He set forth important tasks before the factory. 
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Suphung Bearing Factory. 
					
					 After being briefed on the modernization of the factory, he made the rounds of production processes for hours to learn in detail about its technological updating and production there. 
					
					 Seeing modern equipment and products, he was greatly satisfied to learn that the workers of the factory developed more than 50 kinds of bearings and rapidly increased their production by successfully putting the production processes on a modern and scientific basis. 
					
					He examined the technologically improved machines and equipment and varieties of products ensuring high precision. He said that the workers of the factory solved many scientific and technological problems on their own by pooling their creative ingenuity and boosting cooperation, thereby bringing about a signal boost in production. 
					
					 He underscored the need to channel primary efforts into the introduction of the latest technology and the technological innovation drive, noting that those who have a perfect mastery of science and technology can become conquerors in the future. 
					
					 He called for pushing ahead with the updating of the equipment and the factory in a bold and ambitious manner to steadily boost production with locally available raw materials and their own work force under any circumstances. He indicated the orientation and ways to do so and proposed tasks before the factory. 
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Amnokgang Daily Necessities Factory.
					
					 He looked round several places of the factory including an injection-molding shop to learn in detail about its technological updating and production there.
					
					 It is a revolution that the factory saved equipment enough for furnishing a shop, while securing huge reserve manpower by putting equipment including injection-molding machines on a CNC basis, he noted, extending thanks to its officials, workers and technicians for having achieved great successes in the efforts to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology.
					
					 He praised the factory for successfully manufacturing an ultra-modern uppers injection-moulding machine badly needed for keeping production going at a high rate at the Hyesan Footwear Factory.
					
					 The factory has an important role to play in developing the nation's daily necessities industry and improving the people's standard of living, he said, advancing the important tasks to be carried out by the factory.
					
					 He set the target for putting major production processes on a CNC basis to be attained by the factory till April 2012, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, and specified the orientation and ways for hitting it. He showed such great benevolence as unraveling the problems raised.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Pak To Chun and Kim Phyong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, and Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: CPRK Urges S. Side to Honestly Respond to Proposal for Dialogue
articles.content:
CPRK Urges S. Side to Honestly Respond to Proposal for Dialogue
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Friday gave an answer to a question put by KCNA in connection with the fact that the north side proposed the south side to have dialogues including talks between authorities and took measures of good faith according to the joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations.
					 He recalled that after the joint statement was released the CPRK in a statement of its spokesman formally proposed the south side to have dialogue in order to realize the important proposal clarified in the joint statement and sent to it notices containing technical measures one after another. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 There is no ground whatsoever for the south side to refuse to accept the recent proposal for dialogue as it did not attach any conditionality to the dialogue and its date and venue, etc. are specified in it and it has sufficient modality and procedures for conducting the dialogue.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, however, have not shown any willingness to respond to this proposal under this and that pretext since the very outset. They are taking a negative stand towards it, repeating only the words that "there is no sincerity."
					
					 As regards the north side's step of good faith, they were compelled to agree with the issue of opening the Panmunjom Red Cross liaison channel but they took a cool attitude towards the restart of the work of the office of the Consultative Council for North-South Economic Cooperation, under absurd pretexts. They have not yet sent personnel of the south side to the office and barred the use of its building. 
					
					 This made the north side feel uncomfortable though it made such proposal of good faith.
					
					 As far as "sincerity" is concerned, there is no such sincere proposal as the one advanced by the north as it clarified that it is ready to meet anyone anytime and anywhere without any precondition to tide over the grave situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and improve the north-south relations.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are talking about "counter-proposal" but the north has neither received any formal proposal from them nor known anything about it.
					
					 It is the stand of the north that the south side should come out for dialogue and discuss all the issues at the negotiating table, not making irrelevant remarks.
					
					 There is nothing the north and south sides cannot settle if they sit face to face open-heartedly.
					
					 The door of dialogue is open.
					
					 The south side would be well advised to have a proper stance, though belatedly, and honestly respond to the north side' proposal for dialogue and measures of good faith.

articles.title: Cambodian Crewmen Support New Year Editorial
articles.content:
Cambodian Crewmen Support Joint New Year Editorial
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- A meeting of Cambodian crewmen took place at Hungnam Port on the east coast of the DPRK Friday to support the joint New Year editorial.
					 They expressed the belief that the Korean people would register great successes in their efforts to improve the people's standard of living and build a thriving nation in hearty response to the editorial. 
					
					 All successes in the DPRK are fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, they said.
					
					 Extending solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to avert the danger of war and preserve peace on the Korean Peninsula, they said they would make positive efforts for global independence.
					
					 They adopted a letter to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Gifts from Personages of Kuwait
articles.content:
Gifts from Personages of Kuwait
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from general managers of Al Ritaz Construction Company and other companies of Kuwait on the occasion of his birthday.
					 The gifts were handed to an official concerned of the DPRK working in Kuwait.

articles.title: Book Published
articles.content:
Book Published
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Book "Natural Color Picture Book on Insects, Natural Enemies of Crops" (the first edition) was brought out.
					  The book compiled by researchers of the Institute for Protection of Crops under the Academy of Agricultural Science edits photos and drawings showing the shapes and organism of harmful insects of 224 species. It gives a detailed description of the morphological characteristics of each species and its habit, prey, world distribution, its use and zoological name, etc.
					
					 Among them are 78 species of insects the usage of which is newly clarified though they had been regarded as insects harmful to crops.
					
					 The book deals in detail with the methods of using those insects which prove effective in the agricultural production at present.

articles.title: DPRK to Make 2011 Successful Year in Sports
articles.content:
DPRK to Make 2011 Successful Year in Sports
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK in the New Year joint editorial set a goal to put the nation's sports on a higher level. 
					 The joint editorial stressed the need to raise a hot wind across the country to make Songun Korea widely known as a football and sports power. 
					
					 The DPRK made signal successes in sports last year. 
					
					 The DPRK men's football teams placed first at the AFC Challenger Cup Tournament, U-19 Asian Soccer Championship, U-16 Asian Soccer Championship, 4-nation Soccer Tournament in Qatar and the International Tournament for the Vietnam Football Association Cup. 
					
					 The DPRK women's team won a birth to the 2011 Women's World Cup.
					
					  DPRK players grabbed world and Asian titles in shooting, weight-lifting, boxing and various other events. 
					
					 The DPRK is now channeling efforts into the development of football while positively pushing forward the drive to put sports on a popular and scientific basis and train reserve players.

articles.title: Indigenous Microbial Fertilizer in Wide Use
articles.content:
Indigenous Microbial Fertilizer in Wide Use
Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The microbial fertilizer developed by scientists of the Microbiological Institute under the State Academy of Sciences is proving its efficacy in agricultural production in various cities and counties of South Hwanghae Province, South Phyongan Province and North Hamgyong Province.
					 It is now in wide use at cooperative farms in Yomju County, North Phyongan Province.
					
					 This fertilizer is good for keeping cultivated land from being acidified as it helps plants absorb insoluble phosphate.
					
					 The application of the fertilizer helps keep phosphatic fertilizer effective for a long period, increase the utility rate of nitrogenous fertilizer and prevent the decay of roots of rice plants in mud fields.
					
					 Now that the area of the paddy fields where rice is cultivated with the help of mud snails is on the steady increase, the application of that fertilizer to those fields is helpful to the growth of mud snails and the boost of the yield.
					
					 The fertilizer is now popular among many farms as it can be produced with ease by use of excrements of chickens, ducks and pigs.

articles.title: Relics of Contributor to Unifying Kingdoms into Koryo Unearthed
articles.content:
Relics of Contributor to Unifying Kingdoms into Koryo Unearthed
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Historians of the Academy of Social Sciences discovered relics of the father of the family, which greatly contributed to the cause of unifying kingdoms into Koryo, a unified state, (early in the 10th century to late in the 14th century), from his tomb in a village near Talchon Hot Spring at the foot of Mt. Kuwol recently. 
					 He was Ryu Cha Dal, father of the Munhwa Ryu family. 
					
					 In Korean names surnames denote the titles given according to blood relations of husbands. They vary according to family origins. Ryu has 15 kinds of family roots Munhwa Ryu of which hold a majority.  
					
					 Findings included four tombstones, millstones and a site of a building. 
					
					  Reading the words written on the tombstones of Ryu Cha Dal's tomb, scholars ascertained that the above-said relics were meant for memorial service for Ryu who helped Wangon, the first king of Koryo, to found a unified state. 
					
					 They also said that he was greatly influential in the Munhwa area (area of Samchon County at present) and he was awarded the title of a meritorious subject for his distinguished service for territorial unification.
					
					 His tomb is listed as a national heritage.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Japan's "Four-Party Security Talks" Policy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Japan's "Four-Party Security Talks" Policy
						
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Japan recently set out a policy for building "four-party security talks" framework involving Japan, U.S., Australia and south Korea, according to Rodong Sinmun Friday.
					 The Japanese government has already buckled down to holding regular talks between the directors for foreign and defense affairs from spring this year if possible, a by-lined article of the paper said.
					
					 The paper pointed that the four-party talks allegedly for boosted "security cooperation" in Asia-Pacific are aimed to pressurize, besiege and contain the DPRK and China, not to ensure peace and security in the region as claimed by it. 
					
					 The Japanese government brainstormed this idea, a green light to a war, to take direct part in the military action for reinvasion of Korea with the backing of like-minded supporters. It is making itself fully prepared, prompted by the militarist idea of invading and dominating Korea, China and other Asian countries, the article added. 
					
					 It said the Japanese militarists challenge the trend of the times and the desire of people for peace, oblivious of the lesson from their disgraceful defeat in the past.

articles.title: WPK Remains True to Behests of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
WPK Remains True to Behests of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- All wishes of President Kim Il Sung will be successfully translated into reality and the DPRK will always remain Kim Il Sung's Korea under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea, which subordinates everything to the work for carrying through the last instructions of the President.
					 Rodong Sinmun, a major newspaper of the DPRK, stresses this in a bylined article Friday.
					
					 It says:
					
					 The WPK guides the revolution and construction by taking the President's behests as its lifeline.
					
					 Over the last ten odd years it well showed what attitude and stand are needed to hold the leader of the revolution in high esteem forever and how to adhere to and carry out his behests.
					
					 The WPK has conducted its building and activities as instructed by the President and worked hard to realize his wish for building a thriving nation, setting it as its final target.
					
					 It is now leading the general offensive of all the soldiers and people under the grand plan to open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012 marking the centenary of birth of the President.
					
					 It regards Kim Il Sung's behests as its lifeline and pushes ahead with the building of a thriving socialist country on a new higher stage as it has Kim Jong Il, the peerlessly prominent leader, at its head.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is the great leader who steers the country and the revolution only to victory with the President's behests as a lifeline.
					
					 The WPK led by him is the party in which the steadfast leadership system has been established to put into practice the revolutionary idea of the President on an overall scale. It laid a solid foundation for building a prosperous and powerful country where the President's wishes are all translated into reality and has the single-minded unity of the people and army intensely loyal to his idea and cause.
					
					 Under the leadership of the WPK more miraculous events will take place one after another in the DPRK and the President's behests on building a thriving nation will be successfully implemented.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Respond to DPRK's Proposal
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Respond to DPRK's Proposal
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans' organizations urged the authorities, political parties and organizations of south Korea to positively respond to the fair proposal of the DPRK.
					 The U.S. Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in a statement on Jan. 8 said that the south Korean present "government" has refused to accept the DPRK's proposal for dialogue, talking about "sincerity" while building up improper opinions. 
					
					 There are good precedents in which the north and the south settled issues through dialogue and negotiations and the admirable principles and declarations adopted between them, it noted.
					
					 The United Confederation of Koreans in Ukraine in its statement on Jan. 9 said: The north-south relations are now on the verge of collapse and shells were exchanged between them. This tragic situation is attributable to the foreign forces' war moves and the south Korean authorities' policy of sycophancy toward the U.S. and confrontation with their fellow countrymen.
					
					 To realize reconciliation, cooperation, peace and reunification is what all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad should do together, it stressed.
					
					 The Confederation declared that overseas Koreans would work hard to open a decisive phase for peace on the Korean Peninsula and its reunification.

articles.title: Japanese DM's Junket to S. Korea Rebuffed
articles.content:
Japanese DM's Junket to S. Korea Rebuffed
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic and public organizations at a press conference in Kyonggi Province on Jan. 11 denounced the Japanese defense minister's junket to south Korea aimed at concluding a military agreement.
					 The organizations in a press release voiced strong opposition to his visit to a fleet command.
					
					 The press release held that the action taken by Japan to build legal and institutional mechanisms for boosting military cooperation is designed to justify the Japan "Self-Defense Forces'' advance into the Korean Peninsula and knock a military alliance into shape at an early date.
					
					 It demanded the minister stop at once the discussion on the conclusion of the military agreement and go back home.

articles.title: S. Korea-Japan Military Nexus Condemned
articles.content:
S. Korea-Japan Military Nexus Condemned
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- South Korea and Japan are trying to reach an agreement on protection of military secret and mutual provision of logistic support, according to a joint statement issued by the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea and the New Socialist Party of Japan.
					 The Defense ministers of south Korea and Japan have had talks in Seoul from Jan. 10 under the pretext of "intensified regional security", according to the Jan. 11 statement.
					
					 The U.S. is behind the talks, a dangerous act aimed at justifying Japan's ambition for militarism, said the statement.
					
					 The statement demanded the south Korean and Japanese authorities stop at once the move threatening peace.
					
					 At least 20 civic and public organizations of south Korea held a rally in Seoul on Jan. 9 to condemn the authorities' military tie-up with Japan.  They include the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Society of April Revolution.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Meet to Support New Year Editorial
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Meet to Support New Year Editorial
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) supported the DPRK's joint New Year editorial in Tokyo on Jan. 11.
					 Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, said they would direct this year's activities to upgrading the organization.
					
					 They would make a breakthrough in national education this year, 65th anniversary of the general secondary education and the 55th anniversary of Joson University, he said. They would also make the work with Korean youngsters and traders top priority to rally broad compatriots through mass movement, he added.
					
					 Chongryon would launch vigorous external activities this year to develop friendship and bond with Japanese and make a tangible contribution to building a socialist economic power, he said.
					
					 The meeting adopted a letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Ri Jong Man, managing director of the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, issued a statement on Jan. 9 in support of the editorial and a joint statement of government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- An organization of Russia and officials of Myanmar and Guinea released statements supporting the joint New Year editorial of major newspapers of the DPRK.
					In its statement on Jan. 6 the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea noted that last year the DPRK laid strong material and technical foundations to develop the light industry. We fully support General Secretary Kim Jong Il's line of building a thriving nation and the joint New Year editorial, it said.
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, in a statement on the same day said: It is entirely thanks to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il that the ideal for a thriving nation is being translated into reality in an all-round way in the DPRK.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, in a statement on Jan. 5 referred to last year's achievements of the Korean people mentioned by the joint editorial.
					
					 The Korean people led by Kim Jong Il will make big strides this year, too, he said.

articles.title: Mexico to Commemorate Anniversaries of DPRK
articles.content:
Mexico to Commemorate Anniversaries of DPRK
Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- A Mexican preparatory committee was formed in the city of Mexico on Jan. 6 to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the birthday of President Kim Il Sung, and February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the C.C., the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold various political and cultural events on those occasions.
					
					 On the same day there was an annual meeting of the Mexican National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 At the meeting the committee decided to hold various political and cultural events on a nationwide scale on such important occasions as the birthday of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige fabricas de provincia de Phyong-an del Norte
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige fabricas de provincia de Phyong-an del Norte 
Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno las fabricas de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte donde se levanta la oleada de innovaciones en el trabajo de este ano.
					El Dirigente estuvo primero en el Combinado de Medidores Amnokgang.
					
					Tras escuchar explicaciones ante el plano de la fabrica, recorrio el taller de elaboracion, el de materiales y otros lugares cerciorandose en detalles del estado de dotacion tecnica y produccion.
					
					Al ver los equipos hechos con la tecnologia CNC y alineados en todos los talleres, y los articulos que se producen en cadena, se mostro muy satisfecho de que los obreros de la fabrica produjeran en gran cantidad los medidores de distintos tipos de buena calidad que hacen falta en varias ramas de economia nacional.
					
					Los funcionarios, los obreros y los tecnicos de aqui libraron con dinamismo el movimiento masivo de innovacion tecnica en pleno acato a la idea del Partido de dar importancia a la ciencia y tecnica y de esta manera, pudieron transformar su fabrica a la altura de la era IT, destaco.
					
					Al examinar diversos productos en la exposicion de articulos de consumo popular 3 de Agosto, se mostro muy complacido de que la fabrica produjera los articulos de buena calidad necesarios a la vida del pueblo aprovechando eficientemente las materias residuales. 
					
					Luego, recorrio la casa de cultura construida de modo original, el comedor, el bano y otros establecimientos de cultura e intendencia averiguando las condiciones de vida cultural y autoabastecimiento. 
					
					Por ultimo, presento las tareas programaticas que incumben a la fabrica. 
					
					Acto seguido, el Dirigente se dirigio a la Fabrica de Cojinetes de Suphung.
					
					Escucho explicaciones de la modernizacion de la fabrica y recorrio durante varias horas los procesos productivos para enterarse concretamente del estado de renovacion tecnica y produccion.
					
					Al ver las maquinas y productos modernos, se puso muy contento de que los obreros de la fabrica hayan desarrollado mas de 50 tipos de cojinete y aumentado bruscamente la produccion mediante la modernizacion y la cientifizacion de procesos productivos. 
					
					Examino las maquinas y equipos modernizados y varios productos de alta precision y dijo que los obreros de la fabrica trajeron un cambio trascendental en la produccion al resolver por cuenta propia muchos problemas cientificos y tecnicos uniendo la inteligencia e intensificando la cooperacion. 
					
					Los que sepan la ciencia y tecnica podran conquistar el futuro, asevero y apunto la necesidad de prestar la atencion primordial a la aplicacion de tecnologias sofisticadas y a la innovacion tecnica. 
					
					Deben impulsar con audacia la modernizacion de la fabrica y de los equipos productivos para incrementar en cualesquier circunstancias la produccion con materias primas y fuerzas propias, puntualizo y enseno el rumbo y remedios para el respecto y las tareas a ser cumplidas por la fabrica. 
					
					A continuacion, el Dirigente llego a la Fabrica de Articulos de Uso Diario de Amnokgang. 
					
					  El Dirigente estuvo en varios lugares de la fabrica como taller de moldeado por inyeccion donde se informo de modo pormenorizado del estado de reconstruccion tecnica y produccion.
					
					  Gracias a la introduccion de la tecnologia CNC en los equipos productivos como moldeadora de inyeccion, esta fabrica consiguio gratis los equipos que pueden dotar un taller entero y mucha mano de obra y esto es una revolucion, destaco. 
					
					Agradecio a los funcionarios, los obreros y los tecnicos de la fabrica que lograron grandes exitos en la campana para conquistar las tecnologias de punta.
					
					  En particular, aprecio el hecho de que ellos fabricaron magnificamente la ultramoderna moldeadora por inyeccion de pala de zapato, imprescindible para la normalizacion de produccion de la Fabrica de Zapatos de Hyesan.
					
					  Dijo que la Fabrica de Articulos de Uso Diario de Amnokgang ocupa una posicion importante en desarrollar la industria de articulos de uso diario del pais y mejorar la vida del pueblo.
					
					Al presentar las tareas programaticas que se presentan ante la fabrica, fijo la meta que debe alcanzar ella hasta abril de 2012, ano del centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, es decir, la modernizacion de importantes procesos productivos segun la tecnologia CNC.
					
					Enseno uno por uno el rumbo y los remedios para ese fin y resolvio los problemas pendientes.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak To Chun y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, y Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presentes provenientes de Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presentes provenientes de Kuwait
						
Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presentes que le dirigieran los directores generales de la Compania de Construccion Al Ritaz y otras companias de Kuwait en ocasion del dia de su nacimiento.
					  Los directores generales los entregaron a un funcionario coreano que trabaja en ese pais.

articles.title: Marineros extranjeros apoyan editorial conjunto de Corea
articles.content:
Marineros extranjeros apoyan editorial conjunto de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 14 en el puerto de Hungnam de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur el mitin solidario de los marineros extranjeros para apoyar el editorial conjunto publicado en Corea con motivo del Ano Nuevo.
					Participaron en la ocasion los capitanes y tripulantes de varios barcos de nacionalidad camboyana.
					
					Los oradores expresaron la conviccion de que en acato al editorial conjunto, el pueblo coreano alcanzara grandes exitos en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera. 
					
					Afirmaron que todos los exitos de Corea se deben a la sabia orientacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Manifestaron la solidaridad con la lucha del pueblo coreano por eliminar el peligro de guerra y preservar la paz en la Peninsula Coreana y apuntaron que se debe esforzarse mucho por verificar la independencia en el mundo. 
					
					En el mitin fue aprobada una carta al Dirigente.

articles.title: Editado nuevo libro en Corea
articles.content:
Editado nuevo libro en Corea
  Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ATCC) -- Se dio a luz en Corea el "Libro ilustrado de los insectos en enemistad con los otros nocivos que danan las plantas agricolas" (primera edicion).
					  El libro editado por el Instituto de Proteccion de Botanica de la Academia de Ciencias Agricolas recoge las fotos y pinturas que muestran las figuras y estructuras de 224 especies de insectos utiles.
					
					  Presenta detalladamente la caracteristica morfologica, la costumbre de vida, la comida, la distribucion en el mundo, el estado de uso, el nombre cientifico y otras cosas de cada especie.
					
					  Ademas, ensena como usar esos insectos en la produccion agricola.
					
					Entre ellos, 78 especies han sido descubiertas nuevamente como insectos utiles.

articles.title: Descubierta en Corea la tumba del antecesor de los Ryu
articles.content:
Descubierta en Corea la tumba del antecesor de los Ryu
						
Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ATCC) -- El apellido y el origen familiar son dos indicadores de parentesco en Corea.
					El primero senala el linaje paterno y el segundo indica el lugar de nacimiento del antecesor o el de procedencia de la familia.
					
					  Recientemente, los historiadores de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales descubrieron la tumba del antecesor de los Ryu (de Munhwa) en la comuna de Talchon del distrito de Samchon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					  El apellido Ryu tiene 15 origenes familiares. Entre ellos Munhwa es el primero, del cual se derivaron muchos Ryu.
					
					  El antecesor de los Ryu de Munhwa es Ryu Cha Dal que contribuyo mucho a la causa de reunificacion de Coryo.
					
					  Su tumba esta situada en la aldea cercana a la fuente termal de Talchon al pie del monte Kuwol.
					
					  Segun registros historicos, su tumba se llamaba como mausoleo de los Ryu.
					
					  Ademas del tumulo, hay 4 lapidas, las muelas de piedra y un edificio llamado Mukbangsa.
					
					  De acuerdo con el epigrafe parafraseado por los cientificos, esas reliquias servian para la ceremonia de homenaje a Ryu Cha Dal y este era muy influyente en la zona de Munhwa (actualmente el distrito de Samchon) y recibio el titulo de "Samhanbyoksanggongsin" (subalterno meritorio) por haber contribuido a la reintegracion territorial de Coryo por Wanggon, primer rey de este reino.
					
					  La tumba fue registrada como reliquia nacional bajo la proteccion estatal.
